Row.Text: The Bulgarian mountains hold many secrets. They are grand, and ancient, and their beauty attracts the eyes of all who pass beneath their silent peaks. But enemies soon find that the mountains stare back — and their gaze is anything but friendly.
Much can be learned from observing others unseen.
The mountains have room for more secrets.

In the absence of war, the Bulgarian Empire thrives. The tarkhans, though deprived of battlefields, still cut fine figures in the streets, and the people look increasingly to their authority for mundane matters.
The tarkhans must learn civic government.
Peace is the ideal time to prepare for war.
High in the mountains, a holy man lives alone in a cave, performing miracles among the local populace. Many flock to his remote habitation hoping to benefit from his blessings.
A permanent monastery should be established here.

The monks of Rila Monastery sit in silence within the church, contemplating the divine. Their quiet prayers are suddenly interrupted by voices outside loudly marveling at the artistry of the building’s elaborate frescoes.
The monastery is a space for all Bulgars.
This place is reserved for spiritual contemplation.

The enemy commander rallies his troops as the surrounding wilderness calls out for their deaths. The Bulgars are everywhere and nowhere at once. All night the land echoes with the clanging of shields. The enemy is confused…frightened…exhausted…and when the Bulgars finally attack viciously at dawn, their victory is swift and final.
Tonight the soldiers will drink well.
The war continues — bring in reinforcements!
A priest famed for miracles has established a school for young missionaries. He teaches them a new alphabet, and instructs them to use their education to share their knowledge with all.
Only by spreading this flame can we light the world.
The paths they forge open new opportunities for merchants.

By ship and caravan, missionaries bear Bulgarian spirituality to all who will listen to their teachings. Many new students soon seek additional guidance and set out in hopes of receiving blessings from the Bulgarian saints themselves.
The temples must welcome the masses.
What an incredible market for icons…

Smoke rises from devastated buildings as bolyars load their horses with pillaged goods. The success of their most recent raid energizes them, though they cannot help but wonder how these lands became so rich to begin with.
Perhaps there is something to learn from their prosperity.

As the populace mourns the loss of their capital city, several texts gain popularity throughout the empire. Within, prophets of old relate Bulgaria’s past, present, and future with guidance from angels. Many find comfort in revisiting their history during this turbulent time, though the apocalyptic conclusions are unnerving.
Reminders of the past build hope for the future.
Free Promotion on highest Level Commander.
The divine grants strength to the people.

Visitors to the Bulgarian Empire admire the beauty of its cities and the artistry of its inhabitants. Yet they watch parading soldiers with a twinge of fear, aware that their kingdom may be the next to fall to these bold forces.
Bulgaria’s pride lies in its military.
The Good Doctor at a Crossroads
Inching down a treacherous mountain path, Dr. Rizal mulls over the paradox of the Bulgarian domain — isolated from the world by vast mountains, but connected to it by trade.
